name: Deadbug
how_to_perform:
1. Lie on your back with your arms extended above your head and your legs raised at a 90-degree angle to your hips, with your hands clasped together under the back of your head.
2. Engage your core by drawing your navel towards your spine, keeping it tight throughout the exercise.
3. In a controlled movement, slowly lower your arms behind you without moving your shoulders or upper back out of contact with the floor or mat.
4. As you lower your arms, keep your legs straight and lift your hips off the ground slightly, keeping them in line with your knees.
5. Hold for a brief moment at full extension of your arms above ground level while maintaining contractions in your core muscles.
6. Slowly return to the starting position by bringing your arms back up over your head and lowering your hips back onto the ground.
7. Rest briefly before repeating for the desired number of repetitions.
short_summary: The Deadbug is an exercise that targets the transverse abdominis muscle, specifically working on engaging core stability while performing a movement that challenges your ability to maintain alignment and control throughout repetitions.
